subject: Re: CSS issue in Pricing - Fix

full_threads.body:
Hey Samir!

Thanks so much again for the heads-up!

We’ve gone ahead and adjusted the product entry margins and width for this view to better accommodate a larger font size. That should help improve the overall layout and make things feel more balanced.

Let me know if you'd like to tweak anything further, always happy to help!

Hey Samir,

Thanks for reaching out! We've noted your suggestions regarding the padding and font size, and we’ll take a closer look to improve the layout.

You can expect an update from us by tomorrow.

If anything else comes up in the meantime, feel free to reach out. Always happy to help!

Hi Team,

I think we need to adjust the padding on the cards. Right now, the font size looks too small, and my earlier suggestion doesn't seem to be working well. If we reduce the padding, we'll have more space to work with and can improve the overall layout.

Kind Regards,

Samir Bhatta IT Support | Bachelors of IT |

Proudly Supporting
______________________

E:support@designtiles.com.auu
P: (02) 9567 8971
A: 407 Princes Hwy, Rockdale, NSW 2216



http://wwww.designtiles.com.au/







IMPORTANT: The contents of the email and any attachments are confidential.They are intended for the named recipients(s) only. If you have received this email by mistake, please notify the sender immediately and do not disclose the contents to anyone or make copies thereof.

Hey Samir,

Thanks again for your patience, and apologies for the back-and-forth!

We’ve reverted the mobile layout to 2x2 and adjusted the font size so the pricing fits cleanly on one line. I’ve also cleared the cache and tested it on a phone to double-check everything looks right. You can view the updated page now. You’ll also find a screenshot of the mobile view attached for reference:

Really appreciate you flagging this. If there’s anything else you’d like us to take a look at, just let us know - always happy to help!

Hey @adriane - can you try this out : Here's where to edit the page: https://www.designtiles.com.au/wp-admin/customize.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.designtiles.com.au%2Fproduct-category%2Fon-sale%2Farchitectural-tile-sale%2F

  • They want to make it 2x2 on mobile view
  • The letters should have a small font

Hi Samir,

Got it, thanks for the heads-up.|

We’ll switch the layout back to 2x2 and adjust the font size on mobile so everything fits more cleanly. Our dev will take a look and do their best to keep everything on one line within that layout.

No layout changes will be made without checking in first.

Appreciate the clarity!

Hi Allie,

We definitely don't want to change the product layout to 1x1. Ideally, having two products per row works well. If the font size is causing the issue, we can adjust it specifically for the mobile version. Please let me know in advance if you'd suggest any changes to the layout so we can confirm beforehand and make sure the allocated time is used effectively on the things we actually want.

Kind Regards,

Samir Bhatta IT Support | Bachelors of IT |

Proudly Supporting

Hi Samir,

Thanks so much for sending this through (and for the screenshots!), really appreciate it.

We’ve double-checked on our side and the changes are showing here, so it could be that your browser is still holding onto an older saved version.

Could you try these quick steps?
  • Open this link and refresh it a couple of times:
    https://designtiles.com.au/?refresh=987654
  • If it still looks the same, clear the saved data/cache for the site in your mobile browser.
  • You can also try opening the page using mobile data instead of Wi-Fi to rule out any network cache.

If it’s still not matching after that, please let me know (and a fresh screenshot would be super helpful). That way we can see exactly what you’re seeing and sort it out quickly.

Thanks again for your patience with this, I know it can be a bit fiddly sometimes!

Hi Allie,

Thank you for the changes, but the changes are not reflecting in the mobile version. I have attached the screenshot just for your reference and please note they are opened in an incognito window.



Kind Regards,

Samir Bhatta IT Support | Bachelors of IT |

Proudly Supporting

Hi Samir,

Thanks again for your patience while we sorted this out.

Here’s what we’ve done to fix the issue on mobile:
  • Adjusted the layout so prices now display in one column (instead of two), ensuring they stay on the same line.
  • Cleared the cache so the changes are now reflected on the live site.

Could you please refresh the page on your end and let us know if everything looks consistent now?

Really appreciate you bringing this to our attention, it helps us keep everything running smoothly.

(Time: 30mins)

Hi @allieB,

We got away with it if we put it in 1 column for mobile.

full_threads.body:
Hi team,

This looks odd - the font sizes are inconsistent. Please make all the Prices text the same size and ensure it fits on one line. Font size 16 should work well, as that's what we're using for the regular price below ($139).



Kind Regards,
